pros: Interaction with peers and coaches
cons: Not enough hours at the time

pros: The class sizes are very small and the professors encourage discussion.
cons: There are a limited number of professors per subject.

job_title: Financial Aid Counselor in Fayetteville, NC
pros: Great environment. I wasn't micromanaged. The boss hear me out.
cons: Pay isn't the best. They reward people based off of years of employment, not their quality of work. They like to sweep big issues under the rug and not confront them. They do not train you. They gave me a lot to do that was not in my job description.

pros: good, okay, it depends with the position
cons: It depends with the position that you get

job_title: Computer Science Professor in Fayetteville, NC
pros: Has potential for improvement and to stop the decline if board of trustees seeks new leadership asap.
cons:
Ineffective and toxic leadership brought in by President Wearden and Provost Blum Malley 
Unequal pay/ discrimination all throughout 
Small endowment 
Too many faculty unqualified-with just masters degree 
Lacks inclusion 
Hostile work environment 
Rapid Decline of academic quality 
Minimal if any support for faculty research and development
Unclear, political tenure process 
Overworked and underpaid
Poor communication from leadership and president is rarely seen on campus

pros: Good holiday break, and several very kind people around campus.
cons: University really going downhill. HR and senior admins hire terrible managers who abuse employees. Despite multiple reports, admins and HR do nothing to stop discriminatory language and actions. Zero work-life balance. When you’re done with work, more and more gets piled on. Little to no recognition for employees on the ground and doing the actual work. Managers take all the credit. No pay raises, but given much more responsibility.

job_title: Student Peer Tutor in Fayetteville, NC
pros: Entirely unsatisfying but have to work for a living
cons: Extremely underpaid, no alternative employment or room to expand and grow

review_title: Great place to work, low pay
pros: Small institution, great people to with
cons: low pay, very low adjunct pay

pros: Great schedule and fair benefits
cons: Extremely low salaries for full-time and adjunct faculty.

review_title: If your program makes money, you have a home at MU
pros: Good colleagues across disciplines - general sense of people trying to make poor policy work
cons: No sense of building a community - smaller programs are dispensable - the University is only focusing on those program that make money and athletics.

pros: Friendly atmosphere with some great people to work with
cons: Fayetteville is a military town located on I-95 with a fairly high crime rate. Just be observant and careful

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Fayetteville, NC
pros: Nice co-workers, flexible work time
cons: Minimum wage pay but overall nice experience

pros: The most approachable co-workers I ever had
cons: Absolutely no cons, all good

job_title: Assistant Director for Housing in Fayetteville, NC
pros: Kind people and flexible environment,
cons: Never really sure if budget cuts and lay offs will happen

pros: Remote and Evening hours. Can have other jobs.
cons: Low salary, use of educational platforms without enough support. No classroom keys (in case you need to give a class in-person.

review_title: Feels like home, works like family
job_title: Assistant Professor, Management in Fayetteville, NC
pros: Welcoming, small campus, supportive peers, diverse student body, excellent President, feels like home.
cons: Some entrenched long-time employees, privileged and/or apathetic, resistant to change. Some nepotism. Works like a family--closed ranks against outsiders, plenty of polite infighting inside.

pros: Methodist U is like coming home. The students, staff, and faculty together create a culture of belonging and caring. There are opportunities for collaboration across departments, and for contributing one's unique gifts.
cons: Like family, we sometimes fight and it can get personal because of the high level of individual investment. Not a toxic family, but family nonetheless.

pros: I love the dedicated people I work with.
cons: Financial Instability related to reckless spending of President Ben Hancock; current administration is working to right the ship.

job_title: Associate Professor of English in Fayetteville, NC
pros: Flexible schedule, private office, access to various campus resources and amenities
cons: Poor communication, no transparency between administration and faculty, increasingly hostile work environment, increasing division between groups along ideological lines. The "new normal" is unfortunate because the institution formerly was a great place to work.

pros: Good Benefits , Pay, Stability
cons: Like any other job that you love!

job_title: Quality Engineer I in Memphis, TN
pros: Good place to work good people tp work with.
cons: Not challenging, not using my new skills

pros: Great staff and clean and pay is good
cons: Patient load and acuity is harder

pros: As an office administration, I got to Assist veterans, active-duty services members, National Guard and Reservists and their families by answering basic questions about Methodist University and veterans and dependents educational benefits.
cons: Pay isn't that high compared to companies (although salary isn't my main concern. Fewer opportunities to develop new skills (except when working as research staff

review_title: Methodist has a number of excellent programs, their golf management concentration is highly respected.
pros: Methodist has a beautiful campus in the Sandhills of North Carolina, it takes about 11/2 hours to get to the nearest beach. Several excellent academic programs, many above average faculty members, warmest and hardest working maintenance and custodial staff I've seen, MU elicits strong loyalty in many. Methodist has a strong international program, with excellent students from United World Colleges.
cons: Located in a poor, transient military town with the disadvantages one would expect in such a place. Driving around town is a harrowing experience, and gun shops, pawn shops, and strip clubs are easily found.

pros: Colleagues friendly very helpful, administration also helpful. Campus is private and beautiful. Free tuition for your children at MU as well as its affiliates. Simulation lab equipment top notch.
cons: Low pay as Assistant Professor, no MSN or DNP program. High expectations for committee involvement (typically more than 2). Monthly evening meetings difficult for those with children or house responsibilities

review_title: Moving forward and doing so in a hurry!
pros: Great access to administration and issues are solved with transparency. Administration is aware of personal growth and wanting to move into other professional areas. Compensation is "better" and the administration is open to making it the best it can be.
cons: Lower administration is inconsistent with what being "collegial" means. Only upper administrations seems to get it.

job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Fayetteville, NC
pros: Excellent place to work! Staff, faculty and administration are all phenomenal and make working at Methodist a tremendous experience.
cons: While located in a nicer area of Fayetteville, NC, it is still Fayetteville, NC. The city overall does not seem to be improving in economy, social advancements, or racial equality/tension.

review_title: Great place to be a Clinical Nursing Instructor!
job_title: Clinical Nursing Instructor in Fayetteville, NC
pros: The Department of Nursing Staff,  Very supportive of clinical instructors, Available immediately for questions, motivated students
cons: There are VERY few parking spaces

pros: Flexible Hours, great staff and great working places.
cons:
All jobs no mater what offer 7.25 per hour. 
You may work as TA or as a Lobby worker, you might just sign up and not do any work, still 7.25$.

pros: Supportive and small environment. The work culture is excellent.
cons: Being a student tutor can be very demanding. I am paid and love to help.

pros: Love the interaction with patients and employees, able to move within the system, and decent benefits.
cons: need better raises and wish we could get bonuses

pros: Committed people who work hard
cons: Issues beyond their control regarding the bleak future of small colleges

review_title: RN - ICU/ Neuro and Peripheral Cath Lab
pros: Diverse patient population with educational focus
cons: Minimal ancillary staff support and maximized staffing with minimal employees

pros: Small Campus and a nice environment to work for.
cons:
* Little resources. 
There are plenty of resources available but as much as I believe there should be.

pros: Strong faculty peer support, investment in students.
cons: Struggling to move from traditional age residential day student to serve broader student populations (veterans, adult learners, online learning).

pros: Nice campus with friendly people
cons: Incredible amount of politics on this campus

job_title: Professor of Art in Fayetteville, NC
pros: I do not know of any
cons: salary for long-term professors are inferior

pros: Great place to work. Personable and professional co workers. Great students.
cons: No benefits for part tie workers.

cons: low pay and a lot of hours

cons: too much work for the outcome
